answers.answer: Hi,Testosterone do play a role in the development of male gonads however, there seems to be no conclusive evidence that age is correlated with a decrease in penile size due to hormonal changes. Sexual responses do decrease in intensity as one ages especially in the presence of underlying systemic disease like diabetes , a history of stroke and certain medications.This decrease in sexual response may give the impression that penile size has changed.I  hope this helps.

question: I just turned sixty.  Over the past two years, I have experienced significant loss penis size.  For all of my adult life, I would have been in the larger than normal category, but now I am much smaller.  I have asked about this of several doctors including my urologist, but they change the subject or just pohpoh my concerns.  What can cause this to happen?  Could this be caused by lower hormone levels?I have had numerous kidney stones over the past five years. My prostrate is just slightly larger than normal.
title: diminishing penile size
